channel.title: [pi] command error [pi]

item.title: [pi] command error [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Near_hell Near_hell
item.description:
@Near_hell wrote:

[quote=“s w 3 3 t1, post:9, topic:371008”]nahh its alright, i found out how to add them to pi, since its the only one iv seen im going to post it here for others. this was not done by me, and thankyou guys for trying to help

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“commands”)) { //change name to whatever, info, donate etc.
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
c.flushOutStream();
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@Your Title Here – added by Pistol Pete :D", 8144);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“1”, 8148);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“2”, 8149);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“3”, 8150);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“4”, 8151);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“5”, 8151);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“6”, 8152);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“7”, 8153);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“8”, 8154);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“9”, 8155);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“10”, 8156);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“11”, 8157);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“12”, 8158);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“13”, 8159); // replace the numbers with your text, between the “”
}

simply just replace whats between the " " with your text

@dre@ means the following text will show up in red, that’s how my client interprets it
Code:
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@Your Title Here – added by Pistol Pete :D", 8144)[/quote]Sorry i Tryed

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] command error [pi]
item.dc:creator: @s_w_3_3_t1 s w 3 3 t1
item.description:
@s_w_3_3_t1 wrote:

nahh its alright, i found out how to add them to pi, since its the only one iv seen im going to post it here for others. this was not done by me, and thankyou guys for trying to help

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“commands”)) { //change name to whatever, info, donate etc.
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
c.flushOutStream();
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@Your Title Here – added by Pistol Pete :D", 8144);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“1”, 8148);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“2”, 8149);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“3”, 8150);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“4”, 8151);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“5”, 8151);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“6”, 8152);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“7”, 8153);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“8”, 8154);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“9”, 8155);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“10”, 8156);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“11”, 8157);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“12”, 8158);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“13”, 8159); // replace the numbers with your text, between the “”
}

simply just replace whats between the " " with your text

@dre@ means the following text will show up in red, that’s how my client interprets it
Code:
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@Your Title Here – added by Pistol Pete :D", 8144)

item.title: [pi] command error [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Near_hell Near_hell
item.description:
@Near_hell wrote:

s w 3 3 t1:

i tryed your method but i still got the same errors, would you be able to send me your command without your “rules” details? thankyou.

Sure but my [Pi] is Differnt to alot of them But If you still Getting Errors and u want the rules to pop up then just put in their "command;

(You should not get any Errors with that but no Quest thigny pops up Showing them…

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“rules”)) {
c.sendMessage("@dre@ welcome to killerzow ingame rules");
c.sendMessage(“If you do not follow these rules you will be ip banned”);
c.sendMessage(“NO teaming in Single areas.”);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT GLITCH, Report any glitches to Admins.”);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT impersonate ANYONE (Instant IP BAN)”);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT Disrespect staff members in any way.”);
c.sendMessage(“If a staff member requests to be left alone, please do so”);
c.sendMessage(“Do not dupe/glitch items.”);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT GIVE OUT YOUR PASSWORD TO ANYONE”);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT scam/hack other members.”);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT LOOT OTHER PEOPLES KILLs”);
c.sendMessage(“DO as the staff tells you to do!”);
c.sendMessage(“if anyone has any problems with the rules”);
c.sendMessage(“of would like to add rules please speak with”);
c.sendMessage(“killerz owners (test1 or test2)”);
c.sendMessage(“thankyou and i hope to see you in-game)”);

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] command error [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Near_hell Near_hell
item.description:
@Near_hell wrote:

Thats what i use for my [Pi] Rule Commands

Look at ur (" if (playerCommand.equals(“rules”)) { “) - Change that to (” if (playerCommand.startsWith(“rules”)) { ")
Hope that helped you…
}
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“rules”)) {

			c.sendMessage("Welcome to instress");
			c.sendMessage("1.Do not ask staff for any stuff (mute).");
			c.sendMessage("2.No rules in pking, (Gbs fights are your own risk)");
			c.sendMessage("3.Do not use offensive Language. (Mild flaming aloud)");
			c.sendMessage("4.Do not Scam Passwords or Items (IPBAN)");
			c.sendMessage("5.Auto Clickers are NOT Allowed, Auto Typers are");
			c.sendMessage("if you set the timer to 5 + Seconds");

item.title: [pi] command error [pi]
item.dc:creator: @s_w_3_3_t1 s w 3 3 t1
item.description:
@s_w_3_3_t1 wrote:

hello, i am currently using a pi source base and we’ll i have never coded pi before so please don’t judge me.

i have been adding commands to my base and i hit a hole, i wonted to make it so when i do a command, e.g. ::rules it would show the interface which i have never done on pi.

this is the command iv added, i know there will probably be some big errors in it but i came here knowing that so please don’t judge my noobness :]

command; if (playerCommand.equals(“rules”)) {
c.sendMessage("@dre@ welcome to killerzow ingame rules", 8144);
c.sendMessage(“If you do not follow these rules you will be ip banned”, 8148);
c.sendMessage(“NO teaming in Single areas.”, 8153);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT GLITCH, Report any glitches to Admins.”, 8154);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT impersonate ANYONE (Instant IP BAN)”, 8155);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT Disrespect staff members in any way.”, 8156);
c.sendMessage(“If a staff member requests to be left alone, please do so”, 8157);
c.sendMessage(“Do not dupe/glitch items.”, 8158);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT GIVE OUT YOUR PASSWORD TO ANYONE”, 8161);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT scam/hack other members.”, 8162);
c.sendMessage(“DO NOT LOOT OTHER PEOPLES KILLs”, 8163);
c.sendMessage(“DO as the staff tells you to do!”, 8164);
c.sendMessage(“if anyone has any problems with the rules”, 8165);
c.sendMessage(“of would like to add rules please speak with”, 8166);
c.sendMessage(“killerz owners (test1 or test2)”, 8167);
c.sendMessage(“thankyou and i hope to see you in-game)”, 8168);
c.getPA().sendQuestSomething(8143);
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
c.getPA().flushoutstream();
}

this is the error i got when i compiled.

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:62: sendMessage(java.lang.String)
in server.model.players.Client cannot be applied to (java.lang.String,int)

in server.model.players.Client cannot be applied to (java.lang.String,int)

8148);
